dialog.text: Divide into top and bottom. Top is sky, bottom is all water. For the top part, left a third is mountain, the right a third is mountain. in front of the left mountain, there are trees.
Is the bottom simply water, or is it sea or a river? How tall are the mountains, and how dense or sparse are the trees?
The trees are cross the whole picture horizontally, but left part is higher, like a right skew. center point of the picture, there is a bit of snow
How dense are the trees? Is the snow on the trees, or is there terrain? How tall are the mountains?
Bot is just all water, left third and right third are mountains in the top part. But maybe one tenth space above the mountain is sky.
Are there any peaks in the mountains, or is it mainly round and uniform? Are there any clouds? How dense are the trees?
Left part of the tress is more dense, then will be less dense toward the end of the skew. just the snow at the center point of the picture.
How tall are the mountains? Are there any peaks or is it just round? Are there any clouds?
There are one peak for each mountain on each side. Therefore, there are two peaks total in the picture. There are no clouds
The tree at the center of the picture should be half tall of the trees that is on the left
There should have a wider portion of snow
